info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Columbia, north central Richmond, southwestern Edgefield, west central Aiken and southeastern McCormick Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 340 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clarks Hill Recreation Area, or 12 miles north of Martinez, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Evans, Martinez, Belvedere, Clearwater, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Summerville, Augusta Mall, Daniel Field, Hamilton Branch State Park, Village Plaza Shopping Center, Augusta National Golf Club, Midtown, West End Augusta, Poverty Hill, Scott`s Landing, Savannah Bluffs Heritage Preserve, Vaucluse, Forest Hills and Eisenhower Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 195 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 19 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
